intro: Crataegus moselemensis, commonly known as the Moselem hawthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Europe, particularly in parts of the Balkans. This shrub or small tree typically grows to a height of 3–8 meters and is characterized by its thorny branches and white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but often have a tart flavor. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest edges or rocky slopes.
